Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially greyish in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, the lower section of which is ribbed with the base of one handle surviving, is covered with a self-slip and perhaps faint traces of a black-painted text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394664) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394664)
